flag.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a piece of cloth with a coloured pattern or picture on it that represents a country or organization
flag.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Children waving flags greeted the Russian leader.
Flags were flying at half-mast because of the death of the Premier.
flag.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a coloured piece of cloth used in some sports as a signal or as a sign showing the position of something
flag.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The flag went down, and the race began.
a free kick near the corner flag  (=flag on a football pitch)
flag.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make a mark against some information to show that it is important
flag.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I’ve flagged the parts I want to comment on.
flag.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: By the end of the meeting we had begun to flag.
flag.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to put a special mark against a piece of writing or an email to show that it is important
flag.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: You’ll see that I have flagged the sections that need clarifying.
Send the minutes to everyone at the meeting and flag the email for follow-up.
flag.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a special mark that you put against a piece of writing or an email to show that it is important
